title: Track Awesome Ai4lam Updates Weekly
_seo_title: Track Awesome Ai4lam (AI4LAM/awesome-ai4lam) Updates Weekly - Track Awesome List
description: A list of awesome AI in libraries, archives, and museum collections from around the world üï∂Ô∏è

items.title: Awesome Ai4lam Updates on Jun 17 - Jun 23, 2024
items.summary: 2 awesome projects updated on Jun 17 - Jun 23, 2024
items.content_text:
### Policies and recommendations / Frameworks

*   [LC Labs Artificial Intelligence Planning Framework](https://blogs.loc.gov/thesignal/2023/11/introducing-the-lc-labs-artificial-intelligence-planning-framework/) ‚Äì US Library of Congress planning framework for responsible exploration and adoption of AI
    *   French translation: [Planification de projets IA dans les GLAM (‚≠ê0)](https://github.com/altomator/Planification-de-projets-IA)

### Conferences and Workshops / Past Conferences and Workshops

*   [Fantastic Futures 2024](https://www.nfsa.gov.au/fantastic-futures-conference-canberra-2024) ‚Äì Oct. 15‚Äì18 at The National Film and Sound Archive of Australia (NFSA) in Canberra, Australia.

Policies and recommendations / Frameworks

items.title: Awesome Ai4lam Updates on Mar 04 - Mar 10, 2024
items.summary: 16 awesome projects updated on Mar 04 - Mar 10, 2024
items.content_text:
### Tools and Frameworks / Audio and video analysis, transcription, and labeling

*   [ELAN](https://archive.mpi.nl/tla/elan) ‚Äì addS textual annotations to audio and/or video recordings (Max Planck Institute for Psycholinguistics, The Netherlands)

### Datasets / Datasets available on Hugging Face

*   [Full-text search for "handwritten text recognition"](https://huggingface.co/search/full-text?q=handwritten%20text%20recognition\&type=dataset)
*   [Full-text search for "optical text recognition"](https://huggingface.co/search/full-text?q=optical%20character%20recognition\&type=dataset)
*   [Datasets tagged "summarization"](https://huggingface.co/datasets?task_categories=task_categories%3Asummarization\&type=dataset)
*   [Datasets tagged "feature extraction"](https://huggingface.co/datasets?task_categories=task_categories%3Afeature-extraction\&type=dataset)
*   [Datasets tagged "image classification"](https://huggingface.co/datasets?task_categories=task_categories%3Aimage-classification\&type=dataset\&type=dataset)
*   [Datasets tagged "video classification"](https://huggingface.co/datasets?task_categories=task_categories%3Avideo-classification\&type=dataset)
*   [Datasets tagged "text classification"](https://huggingface.co/datasets?task_categories=task_categories%3Atext-classification\&type=dataset)
*   [Datasets tagged "audio classification"](https://huggingface.co/datasets?task_categories=task_categories%3Aaudio-classification\&type=dataset)

### Datasets / Datasets available elsewhere

*   [HTR datasets in Zenodo](https://zenodo.org/search?q=metadata.subjects.subject%3A%22handwritten%20text%20recognition%22\&l=list\&p=1\&s=10\&sort=bestmatch) ‚Äì subject search in Zenodo
*   [Open data collections from the National Library of Scotland](https://data.nls.uk/)

### Projects, Initiatives, and Case Studies / Select individual projects

*   [Argilla prompt-collective](https://huggingface.co/spaces/DIBT/prompt-collective) ‚Äì crowdsourcing effort to rank 50,000 prompts, on Hugging Face
*   [BigLAM](https://huggingface.co/biglam) ‚Äì BigScience Libraries, Archives and Museums on Hugging Face
*   [Nasjonalbiblioteket AI Lab](https://huggingface.co/NbAiLab) ‚Äì National Library of Norway on Hugging Face
*   [KBLab](https://huggingface.co/KBLab) ‚Äì National Library of Sweden on Hugging Face
*   [PleIAs](https://huggingface.co/PleIAs) ‚Äì French organization training LLMs with an open science approach
items.content_html:
Tools and Frameworks / Audio and video analysis, transcription, and labeling

  • ELAN ‚Äì addS textual annotations to audio and/or video recordings (Max Planck Institute for Psycholinguistics, The Netherlands)

Datasets / Datasets available on Hugging Face

  • Full-text search for "handwritten text recognition"
  • Full-text search for "optical text recognition"
  • Datasets tagged "summarization"
  • Datasets tagged "feature extraction"
  • Datasets tagged "image classification"
  • Datasets tagged "video classification"
  • Datasets tagged "text classification"
  • Datasets tagged "audio classification"

Datasets / Datasets available elsewhere

  • HTR datasets in Zenodo ‚Äì subject search in Zenodo
  • Open data collections from the National Library of Scotland

Projects, Initiatives, and Case Studies / Select individual projects

  • Argilla prompt-collective ‚Äì crowdsourcing effort to rank 50,000 prompts, on Hugging Face
  • BigLAM ‚Äì BigScience Libraries, Archives and Museums on Hugging Face
  • Nasjonalbiblioteket AI Lab ‚Äì National Library of Norway on Hugging Face
  • KBLab ‚Äì National Library of Sweden on Hugging Face
  • PleIAs ‚Äì French organization training LLMs with an open science approach

items.title: Awesome Ai4lam Updates on Feb 05 - Feb 11, 2024
items.summary: 18 awesome projects updated on Feb 05 - Feb 11, 2024
items.content_text:
### Learning Resources / Introductions to AI

*   [Introduction to AI for GLAM](https://carpentries-incubator.github.io/machine-learning-librarians-archivists/) ‚Äì by Library Carpentries

### Learning Resources / Computer vision

*   [Computer Vision for Heritage Collections](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1FpKfX4hI38ZKG81osa3bXgitEArxK45NKmT6NOyrnJk) ‚Äì French-language 2‚ÄØhr workshop designed to introduce computer vision applications to cultural heritage professionals

### Learning Resources / Other "awesome" lists in AI and ML

*   [Awesome Deep Learning (‚≠ê26k)](https://github.com/ChristosChristofidis/awesome-deep-learning#readme)
*   [Awesome Deep Learning Resources (‚≠ê1.7k)](https://github.com/guillaume-chevalier/awesome-deep-learning-resources#readme)
*   [Awesome Deep Vision (‚≠ê11k)](https://github.com/kjw0612/awesome-deep-vision#readme)
*   [Awesome Document Understanding (‚≠ê1.4k)](https://github.com/tstanislawek/awesome-document-understanding#readme)
*   [Awesome Image Classification (‚≠ê3k)](https://github.com/weiaicunzai/awesome-image-classification#readme)
*   [Awesome Machine Learning (‚≠ê69k)](https://github.com/josephmisiti/awesome-machine-learning#readme)
*   [Awesome Machine Learning & Deep Learning Tutorials (‚≠ê16k)](https://github.com/ujjwalkarn/Machine-Learning-Tutorials#readme)
*   [Awesome Natural Language Generation (‚≠ê468)](https://github.com/accelerated-text/awesome-nlg#readme)
*   [Awesome NLP (‚≠ê17k)](https://github.com/keon/awesome-nlp#readme)
*   [Awesome Production Machine Learning (‚≠ê19k)](https://github.com/EthicalML/awesome-production-machine-learning#readme)
*   [Awesome Software Engineering for Machine Learning (‚≠ê1.3k)](https://github.com/SE-ML/awesome-seml#readme)
*   [Awesome Visual Transformer (‚≠ê3.5k)](https://github.com/dk-liang/Awesome-Visual-Transformer#readme)
*   [Awesome XAI (‚≠ê165)](https://github.com/altamiracorp/awesome-xai#readme)

### Conferences and Workshops / Upcoming Conferences and Workshops

*   [BitCurator Forum](https://bitcuratorconsortium.org/forum) ‚Äì Mar. 19‚Äì22 virtual event on digital forensics, digital archives, and related digital analysis workflows
*   [Digital Library Federation (DLF) 2024 Forum](https://forum2024.diglib.org) ‚Äì Jul. 29‚Äì31 at Michigan State U., East Lansing, Michigan, USA.
*   [International Conference on Document Analysis and Recognition (ICDAR) 2024](https://icdar2024.net) ‚Äì Aug. 30‚ÄìSep. 4 in Athens, Greece.

items.title: Awesome Ai4lam Updates on Jan 22 - Jan 28, 2024
items.summary: 16 awesome projects updated on Jan 22 - Jan 28, 2024
items.content_text:
### Learning Resources / Generative AI

*   [What are large language models (LLMs)?](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iR2O2GPbB0E) ‚Äì (YouTube) by Google for Developers
*   [Generative AI for Everyone](https://www.coursera.org/learn/generative-ai-for-everyone?irclickid=S5hzeGTIExyPTTOSNn2PRyfHUkHzH8TNw0Bo1c0\&irgwc=1) ‚Äì free Coursera course by Andrew Ng
*   [What Is ChatGPT Doing ‚Ä¶ and Why Does It Work?](https://writings.stephenwolfram.com/2023/02/what-is-chatgpt-doing-and-why-does-it-work/) ‚Äì by Stephen Wolfram

### Publications and News Sources / Journals and Magazines

*   [AI & Society](https://link.springer.com/journal/146/articles)
*   [Archival Science](https://link.springer.com/journal/10502)
*   [Big Data & Society](https://journals.sagepub.com/home/bds)
*   [Digital Humanities Quarterly](https://digitalhumanities.org/dhq/)
*   [Digital Scholarship in the Humanities](https://academic.oup.com/dsh)
*   [Journal of Cultural Analytics](https://culturalanalytics.org)
*   [Journal of Documentation](https://www.emerald.com/insight/publication/issn/0022-0418)
*   [Journal of Open Humanities Data](https://openhumanitiesdata.metajnl.com)
*   [Journal of the Association for Information Science and Technology](https://asistdl.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/journal/23301643)
*   [Library Hi Tech](https://www.emerald.com/insight/publication/issn/0737-8831)
*   [Literary and Linguistic Computing](https://dl.acm.org/journal/lilc)
*   [Social Science Computer Review](https://journals.sagepub.com/description/SSC)
*   [World Digital Libraries ‚Äì An International Journal](https://content.iospress.com/journals/world-digital-libraries-an-international-journal)
items.content_html:
Learning Resources / Generative AI

  • What are large language models (LLMs)? ‚Äì (YouTube) by Google for Developers

items.title: Awesome Ai4lam Updates on Jan 15 - Jan 21, 2024
items.summary: 71 awesome projects updated on Jan 15 - Jan 21, 2024
items.content_text:
### Learning Resources / Introductions to AI

*   [Elements of AI](https://www.elementsofai.com/) ‚Äì free course by MinnaLearn & University of Helsinki
*   [AI Guide by the AI Pedagogy Project](https://aipedagogy.org) ‚Äì collection of materials by [metaLAB](https://mlml.io/about/)
*   [Slides from FF23 workshop on *Intro to AI for GLAM*](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1dVdS3u-XS2RDexNm3RlwICCsh5gBmdi1pBARgIGnPN8) and [shared notes](https://pad.carpentries.org/intro-ai-ff2023)
*   [Machine Learning 101](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1kSuQyW5DTnkVaZEjGYCkfOxvzCqGEFzWBy4e9Uedd9k/edit#slide=id.g168a3288f7_0_58) ‚Äì by Jason Mayes from Google
*   [A Collection of AI Demos to Discover and Explore](https://exploreai.jisc.ac.uk/)

### Learning Resources / Computer vision

*   [A Gentle Introduction to Computer Vision](https://machinelearningmastery.com/what-is-computer-vision/) ‚Äì from Machine Learning Mastery
*   [Computer Vision for the Humanities: An Introduction to Deep Learning for Image Classification](https://programminghistorian.org/en/lessons/computer-vision-deep-learning-pt1) ‚Äì two-part intro by the Programming Historian

### Learning Resources / Natural language processing

*   [A Code-First Introduction to NLP](https://www.fast.ai/posts/2019-07-08-fastai-nlp.html) ‚Äì by Rachel Thomas of fast.ai
*   [NLP course](https://lena-voita.github.io/nlp_course.html) and associated [GitHub repo (‚≠ê10k)](https://github.com/yandexdataschool/nlp_course#readme) ‚Äì by Elena Voita
*   [NLP accelerated class](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL8P_Z6C4GcuWfAq8Pt6PBYlck4OprHXsw) ‚Äì by Machine Learning University
*   [Overview of deep learning techniques applied to NLP (2018)](https://nlpoverview.com/index.html)
*   [Deep Learning for NLP](https://machinelearningmastery.com/category/natural-language-processing/) ‚Äì from Machine Learning Mastery
*   [Hands-on NLTK Tutorial (‚≠ê558)](https://github.com/hb20007/hands-on-nltk-tutorial#readme)
*   [NLP in Python - Quickstart Guide (‚≠ê588)](https://github.com/NirantK/NLP_Quickbook#readme)
*   [Deep Learning for NLP With Pytorch](https://pytorch.org/tutorials/beginner/deep_learning_nlp_tutorial.html)

### Learning Resources / Generative AI

*   [A Very Gentle Introduction to LLMs without the Hype](https://mark-riedl.medium.com/a-very-gentle-introduction-to-large-language-models-without-the-hype-5f67941fa59e) ‚Äì by Mark Riedl
*   [A brief introduction to GenAI](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1X3VpadTOsUe2neFts24pURy3nNQ2k64k4d3MEqHlEgk/edit#slide=id.g25b6aed46c6_0_492) ‚Äì by U. Michigan MIDAS
*   [Understanding LLMs ‚Äì A Transformative Reading List](https://sebastianraschka.com/blog/2023/llm-reading-list.html)
*   [Large Language Model Course (‚≠ê57k)](https://github.com/mlabonne/llm-course#readme)

### Learning Resources / Other "awesome" lists in AI and ML

*   [Awesome Computer Vision (‚≠ê22k)](https://github.com/jbhuang0604/awesome-computer-vision#readme)
*   [Awesome Deep Learning for Natural Language Processing (NLP) (‚≠ê1.3k)](https://github.com/brianspiering/awesome-dl4nlp#readme)
*   [Awesome Generative AI (‚≠ê8.8k)](https://github.com/steven2358/awesome-generative-ai#readme)
*   [Awesome Jupyter GLAM (‚≠ê19)](https://github.com/LibraryCarpentry/awesome-jupyter-glam#readme)
*   [The NLP Index](https://index.quantumstat.com)

### Tools and Frameworks / Document analysis, transcription, and labeling

*   [Callico](https://teklia.com/blog/open-sourcing-callico/) ‚Äì open-source web platform for document annotation
*   [Distributed Annotation 'n' Enrichment (DANE) (‚≠ê4)](https://github.com/CLARIAH/DANE#readme) ‚Äì compute task assignment & file storage for automatic annotation of content ([CLARIAH](https://www.clariah.nl/about-clariah), Norway)
*   [HTRFLOW demo](https://huggingface.co/spaces/Riksarkivet/htr_demo) and associated [GitHub repo (‚≠ê33)](https://github.com/Swedish-National-Archives-AI-lab/htrflow_app) ‚Äì explore AI models for Handwritten Text Recogntion (Swedish National Archives)
*   [Label Studio](https://labelstud.io) ‚Äì data labeling platform to fine-tune LLMs, prepare training data, or validate AI models
*   [OCR correction](https://bnl.public.lu/en.html) ‚Äì OCR correction tools (Biblioth√®que nationale, Luxembourg)
*   [Surya (‚≠ê18k)](https://github.com/VikParuchuri/surya#readme) ‚Äì multilingual document OCR toolkit with line-level text detection
*   [Text models from the National Library of Sweden](https://huggingface.co/KBLab) ‚Äì available on Hugging Face
*   [Transkribus](https://readcoop.eu/transkribus/) ‚Äì transcription, recognition, & searching of historical documents

### Tools and Frameworks / Audio and video analysis, transcription, and labeling

*   [Acoustic models from the National Library of Sweden](https://huggingface.co/KBLab) ‚Äì available on Hugging Face
*   [Audiovisual Metadata Platform (AMP)](https://uisapp2.iu.edu/confluence-prd/display/AMP/AMP%3A+Audiovisual+Metadata+Platform) ‚Äì generation of metadata for discovery & use of digital audio & video collections (Indiana U., USA)
*   [CAMPI](https://kilthub.cmu.edu/articles/preprint/CAMPI_Computer-Aided_Metadata_Generation_for_Photo_archives_Initiative/12791807) ‚Äì Computer-Aided Metadata Generation for Photo archives Initiative (Carnegie Mellonw U., USA)
*   [inaFaceAnalyzer (‚≠ê23)](https://github.com/ina-foss/inaFaceAnalyzer#readme) ‚Äì Python toolbox for face-based description of gender representation in media (Institut National de l'Audiovisuel, France)
*   [Newspaper Navigator](https://labs.loc.gov/work/experiments/newspaper-navigator/) ‚Äì explore visual & textual content in the *Chronicling America* digitized newspaper collection (Library of Congress, USA)
*   [Oodi](https://medium.com/headai-customer-stories/customer-story-oodi-1d1ef2554bb6) ‚Äì virtual information assistant (Helsinki Central Library)
*   [ReTV](https://retv-project.eu) ‚Äì video analysis & summarization (Modul Univesrity, Austria)

### Tools and Frameworks / Indexing and classification

*   [Annif](https://annif.org) and [associated tutorial (‚≠ê42)](https://github.com/NatLibFi/Annif-tutorial) ‚Äì tool for automated subject indexing and classification (National Library of Finland)

### Tools and Frameworks / Search and retrieval

*   [GallicaPix](https://gallicapix.bnf.fr/rest?run=findIllustrations-form.xq) ‚Äì retrieval of heritage images (Biblioth√®que nationale de France)
*   [GallicaSNOOP](https://www.bnf.fr/sites/default/files/2022-05/Poster_Gallica_Snoop.pdf) ‚Äì framework for large-scale content-based image retrieval (Biblioth√®que nationale de France)
*   [Maken Similarity Service](https://www.nb.no/maken/) ‚Äì tools for alternative reading & finding similar photographs (National Library of Norway)
*   [Semantic search for Nasjonalmuseet‚Äôs online collection](https://beta.nasjonalmuseet.no/2023/08/add-semantic-search-to-a-online-collection/) ‚Äì open beta test (National Museum of Norway)
*   [VGG Text Search (VTS) Engine](https://www.robots.ox.ac.uk/~vgg/software/vts/) ‚Äì search for text strings over a user-defined image set

### Tools and Frameworks / Applications of Transformers, LLMs, and GPT

*   [BERTopic](https://maartengr.github.io/BERTopic/index.html) ‚Äì topic modeling technique that leverages Transformers and c-TF-IDF
*   [Chatbot for Luxembourgish newspapers](https://chat.eluxemburgensia.lu/login?next=/) ‚Äì uses ChatGPT and understands French, German and English (Biblioth√®que nationale de Luxembourg)
*   [Norwegian Transformer Model (NoTraM) (‚≠ê116)](https://github.com/NBAiLab/notram#readme) ‚Äì transformer model for Norwegian and Nordic languages (National Library of Norway)
*   [Swedish BERT (‚≠ê140)](https://github.com/Kungbib/swedish-bert-models#readme) ‚Äì BERT model for the Swedish language (Royal Library of Sweden)
*   [Visual AI](https://www.robots.ox.ac.uk/~vgg/projects/visualai/index.html) ‚Äì open-world interpretable visual transformer (UK)

### Datasets / Datasets available elsewhere

*   [Gensim datasets (‚≠ê1k)](https://github.com/piskvorky/gensim-data#readme) ‚Äì repository of datasets for unstructured text processing
*   [HTR-United](https://htr-united.github.io) ‚Äì datasets for training transcription or segmentation models
*   [Kaggle datasets](https://www.kaggle.com/datasets)
*   [nlp-datasets (‚≠ê5.9k)](https://github.com/niderhoff/nlp-datasets#readme) ‚Äì free/public domain datasets with text data for use in NLP
*   [Open Library data dumps](https://openlibrary.org/developers/dumps) ‚Äì from the Internet Archive
*   [Registry of Open Data on AWS](https://registry.opendata.aws) ‚Äì datasets tagged by topic

### Projects, Initiatives, and Case Studies / Project lists & directories

*   [List of Artificial Intelligence (AI) initiatives in museums](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1A7IVnucQZ0ICxYSOCjqQ1oV3xGgNzDKtIYGrk6smV7w/edit#gid=0) ‚Äì compiled in 2021 by Elena Villaespesa, Oonagh Murphy and Kate Nadel for the [Museums+AI Network](https://themuseumsai.network) project.
*   [Projects in AI Registry (PAIR)](https://libraries.ou.edu/content/project-highlight-projects-ai-registry-pair) ‚Äì registry of AI projects in higher education (U. Oklahoma Libraries, USA)

### Projects, Initiatives, and Case Studies / Select individual projects

*   [Living with Machines](https://livingwithmachines.ac.uk) ‚Äì Turing Institute & British Library
*   [Machine Learning with Archive Collections](https://blog.archiveshub.jisc.ac.uk/2022/02/28/machine-learning-with-archive-collections/)
*   [Vatican Manuscripts](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8khPUtwaVaw) ‚Äì machine transcription in the Vatican Secret Archive

### Policies and recommendations / Statements by organizations and government bodies

*   [ACM TechBrief on Generative AI, by the ACM Technology Policy Council](https://dl.acm.org/doi/pdf/10.1145/3626110)
*   [Canadian Government *Principles for responsible, trustworthy and privacy-protective generative AI technologies*](https://www.priv.gc.ca/en/privacy-topics/technology/artificial-intelligence/gd_principles_ai/)

### Policies and recommendations / Surveys of policies and recommendations

*   [A cluster analysis of national AI strategies](https://www.brookings.edu/articles/a-cluster-analysis-of-national-ai-strategies/) ‚Äì Brookings Institute analysis of different countries‚Äô national AI strategies, Dec. 2023
*   [A principled governance for emerging AI regimes: lessons from China, the European Union, and the United States](https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s43681-022-00205-0) by R. B. L. Dixon in *AI and Ethics*, 3, 793‚Äì810, 2023
*   [AI Governance Alliance: Briefing Paper Series](https://www.weforum.org/publications/ai-governance-alliance-briefing-paper-series/) ‚Äì by the World Economic Forum, Jan. 2024
*   [AI policies across the globe: Implications and recommendations for libraries](https://doi.org/10.1177/0340035223119617) by L.¬†S. Lo in *IFLA Journal*, 49(4), 645‚Äì649, 2023
*   [Principled Artificial Intelligence: Mapping Consensus in Ethical and Rights-Based Approaches to Principles for AI](http://dx.doi.org/10.2139/ssrn.3518482) by Fjeld et al, Berkman Klein Center Research Publication No. 2020-1, 2020
*   [What ethics do I need to consider when using AI?](https://www.muchaduabout.com/post/what-ethics-do-i-need-to-consider-when-using-ai) ‚Äì blog posting by Livi Adu, Nov. 2023

### Conferences and Workshops / Upcoming Conferences and Workshops

*   [International Conference on Digital Preservation (iPRES) 2024](https://ipres2024.pubpub.org) ‚Äì Sep. 16‚Äì20 in Ghent & Flanders, Belgium.

### Publications and News Sources / Journals and Magazines

*   [AI Magazine](https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/loi/23719621)
items.content_html:
Learning Resources / Introductions to AI

  • Elements of AI ‚Äì free course by MinnaLearn & University of Helsinki
  • AI Guide by the AI Pedagogy Project ‚Äì collection of materials by metaLAB
  • Slides from FF23 workshop on Intro to AI for GLAM and shared notes
  • Machine Learning 101 ‚Äì by Jason Mayes from Google
  • A Collection of AI Demos to Discover and Explore

Learning Resources / Computer vision

  • A Gentle Introduction to Computer Vision ‚Äì from Machine Learning Mastery
  • Computer Vision for the Humanities: An Introduction to Deep Learning for Image Classification ‚Äì two-part intro by the Programming Historian

Learning Resources / Natural language processing

  • A Code-First Introduction to NLP ‚Äì by Rachel Thomas of fast.ai
  • NLP course and associated GitHub repo (‚≠ê10k) ‚Äì by Elena Voita
  • NLP accelerated class ‚Äì by Machine Learning University
  • Overview of deep learning techniques applied to NLP (2018)
  • Deep Learning for NLP ‚Äì from Machine Learning Mastery
  • Hands-on NLTK Tutorial (‚≠ê558)
  • NLP in Python - Quickstart Guide (‚≠ê588)
  • Deep Learning for NLP With Pytorch

Learning Resources / Generative AI

  • A Very Gentle Introduction to LLMs without the Hype ‚Äì by Mark Riedl
  • A brief introduction to GenAI ‚Äì by U. Michigan MIDAS
  • Understanding LLMs ‚Äì A Transformative Reading List
  • Large Language Model Course (‚≠ê57k)

Learning Resources / Other "awesome" lists in AI and ML

  • Awesome Computer Vision (‚≠ê22k)
  • Awesome Deep Learning for Natural Language Processing (NLP) (‚≠ê1.3k)
  • Awesome Generative AI (‚≠ê8.8k)
  • Awesome Jupyter GLAM (‚≠ê19)
  • The NLP Index

Tools and Frameworks / Document analysis, transcription, and labeling

  • Callico ‚Äì open-source web platform for document annotation
  • Distributed Annotation 'n' Enrichment (DANE) (‚≠ê4) ‚Äì compute task assignment & file storage for automatic annotation of content (CLARIAH, Norway)
  • HTRFLOW demo and associated GitHub repo (‚≠ê33) ‚Äì explore AI models for Handwritten Text Recogntion (Swedish National Archives)
  • Label Studio ‚Äì data labeling platform to fine-tune LLMs, prepare training data, or validate AI models
  • OCR correction ‚Äì OCR correction tools (Biblioth√®que nationale, Luxembourg)
  • Surya (‚≠ê18k) ‚Äì multilingual document OCR toolkit with line-level text detection
  • Text models from the National Library of Sweden ‚Äì available on Hugging Face
  • Transkribus ‚Äì transcription, recognition, & searching of historical documents

Tools and Frameworks / Audio and video analysis, transcription, and labeling

  • Acoustic models from the National Library of Sweden ‚Äì available on Hugging Face
  • Audiovisual Metadata Platform (AMP) ‚Äì generation of metadata for discovery & use of digital audio & video collections (Indiana U., USA)
  • CAMPI ‚Äì Computer-Aided Metadata Generation for Photo archives Initiative (Carnegie Mellonw U., USA)
  • inaFaceAnalyzer (‚≠ê23) ‚Äì Python toolbox for face-based description of gender representation in media (Institut National de l'Audiovisuel, France)
  • Newspaper Navigator ‚Äì explore visual & textual content in the Chronicling America digitized newspaper collection (Library of Congress, USA)
  • Oodi ‚Äì virtual information assistant (Helsinki Central Library)
  • ReTV ‚Äì video analysis & summarization (Modul Univesrity, Austria)

Tools and Frameworks / Indexing and classification

  • Annif and associated tutorial (‚≠ê42) ‚Äì tool for automated subject indexing and classification (National Library of Finland)

Tools and Frameworks / Search and retrieval

  • GallicaPix ‚Äì retrieval of heritage images (Biblioth√®que nationale de France)
  • GallicaSNOOP ‚Äì framework for large-scale content-based image retrieval (Biblioth√®que nationale de France)
  • Maken Similarity Service ‚Äì tools for alternative reading & finding similar photographs (National Library of Norway)
  • Semantic search for Nasjonalmuseet‚Äôs online collection ‚Äì open beta test (National Museum of Norway)
  • VGG Text Search (VTS) Engine ‚Äì search for text strings over a user-defined image set

Tools and Frameworks / Applications of Transformers, LLMs, and GPT

  • BERTopic ‚Äì topic modeling technique that leverages Transformers and c-TF-IDF
  • Chatbot for Luxembourgish newspapers ‚Äì uses ChatGPT and understands French, German and English (Biblioth√®que nationale de Luxembourg)
  • Norwegian Transformer Model (NoTraM) (‚≠ê116) ‚Äì transformer model for Norwegian and Nordic languages (National Library of Norway)
  • Swedish BERT (‚≠ê140) ‚Äì BERT model for the Swedish language (Royal Library of Sweden)
  • Visual AI ‚Äì open-world interpretable visual transformer (UK)

Datasets / Datasets available elsewhere

  • Gensim datasets (‚≠ê1k) ‚Äì repository of datasets for unstructured text processing
  • HTR-United ‚Äì datasets for training transcription or segmentation models
  • Kaggle datasets
  • nlp-datasets (‚≠ê5.9k) ‚Äì free/public domain datasets with text data for use in NLP
  • Open Library data dumps ‚Äì from the Internet Archive
  • Registry of Open Data on AWS ‚Äì datasets tagged by topic

Projects, Initiatives, and Case Studies / Project lists & directories

  • List of Artificial Intelligence (AI) initiatives in museums ‚Äì compiled in 2021 by Elena Villaespesa, Oonagh Murphy and Kate Nadel for the Museums+AI Network project.
  • Projects in AI Registry (PAIR) ‚Äì registry of AI projects in higher education (U. Oklahoma Libraries, USA)

Projects, Initiatives, and Case Studies / Select individual projects

  • Living with Machines ‚Äì Turing Institute & British Library
  • Machine Learning with Archive Collections
  • Vatican Manuscripts ‚Äì machine transcription in the Vatican Secret Archive

Policies and recommendations / Statements by organizations and government bodies

  • ACM TechBrief on Generative AI, by the ACM Technology Policy Council
  • Canadian Government Principles for responsible, trustworthy and privacy-protective generative AI technologies

Policies and recommendations / Surveys of policies and recommendations

  • A cluster analysis of national AI strategies ‚Äì Brookings Institute analysis of different countries‚Äô national AI strategies, Dec. 2023
  • A principled governance for emerging AI regimes: lessons from China, the European Union, and the United States by R. B. L. Dixon in AI and Ethics, 3, 793‚Äì810, 2023
  • AI Governance Alliance: Briefing Paper Series ‚Äì by the World Economic Forum, Jan. 2024
  • AI policies across the globe: Implications and recommendations for libraries by L.¬†S. Lo in IFLA Journal, 49(4), 645‚Äì649, 2023
  • Principled Artificial Intelligence: Mapping Consensus in Ethical and Rights-Based Approaches to Principles for AI by Fjeld et al, Berkman Klein Center Research Publication No. 2020-1, 2020
  • What ethics do I need to consider when using AI? ‚Äì blog posting by Livi Adu, Nov. 2023

Conferences and Workshops / Upcoming Conferences and Workshops

  • International Conference on Digital Preservation (iPRES) 2024 ‚Äì Sep. 16‚Äì20 in Ghent & Flanders, Belgium.

Publications and News Sources / Journals and Magazines

  • AI Magazine

items.content_text:
### Learning Resources / Generative AI

*   [The Map Of Transformers](https://towardsdatascience.com/the-map-of-transformers-e14952226398)
*   [The Illustrated Transformer](https://jalammar.github.io/illustrated-transformer/), a visual introduction to transformers
*   [Introduction to Generative AI](https://www.cloudskillsboost.google/paths/118), by Google
*   [Generative AI for Beginners - A Course](https://microsoft.github.io/generative-ai-for-beginners/#/), by Microsoft
*   [A Generative AI Primer](https://nationalcentreforai.jiscinvolve.org/wp/2023/10/16/generative-ai-primer/), by the UK's National Centre for AI

### Learning Resources / AI in galleries, libraries, archives and museums

*   The [CENL "AI in Libraries" network group](https://www.cenl.org/networkgroups/ai-in-libraries-network-group/) is also organizing webinars on AI implementation in GLAM.

### Learning Resources / AI in galleries, libraries, archives and museums

(See also [related article in MIT News](https://news.mit.edu/2023/mit-group-releases-white-papers-governance-ai-1211).)

items.content_text:
### Conferences and Workshops / Upcoming Conferences and Workshops

*   [IIPC General Assembly & Web Archiving Conference](https://netpreserve.org/ga2024/) ‚Äì Apr. 24‚Äì26 at the Biblioth√®que nationale de France, Paris, France.
*   [Fantastic Futures 2024](https://www.nfsa.gov.au/fantastic-futures-canberra-2024-artificial-intelligence-libraries-archives-and-museums) ‚Äì Oct. 16‚Äì18 at the National Film and Sound Archive of Australia (NFSA), Canberra, Australia.

### Conferences and Workshops / Past Conferences and Workshops

*   [ai4Libraries Conference](https://www.ai4libraries.org) ‚Äì Oct. 19 virtual event hosted by Georgia Tech Library, Atlanta, Georgia, USA.
*   [Fantastic Futures 2018](https://www.nb.no/hva-skjer/ai-conference/) ‚Äì Dec. 5 at the National Library of Norway, Oslo, Norway.
*   [Fantastic Futures 2019](https://wayback.stanford.edu/was/20230508165810/http://library.stanford.edu/projects/fantastic-futures) ‚Äì Dec. 4‚Äì6 at Stanford University, Stanford, California, USA.
*   [Fantastic Futures 2021](https://www.bnf.fr/fr/captations-et-supports-de-la-conference-2021) ‚Äì Dec. 8‚Äì10 at the Biblioth√®que nationale de France, Paris, France.
*   [Fantastic Futures 2022](https://sites.google.com/view/ai4lam/ai4lam-2022-virtual-event) ‚Äì Nov. 30‚ÄìDec. 2 virtual event hosted by the British Library, London, England.
*   [Fantastic Futures 2023](https://ff2023.archive.org) ‚Äì Nov. 15‚Äì17 at Internet Archive Canada Headquarters, Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada.
